WRITING.TEXT: Seems to be pretty cool. I'll definitely keep playing.
I'll try enjoying it more. Everyone say it gets better in the DLC and and latter part of the games. Gotta keep pushing.
What is it that makes you love it. I wanna enjoy the game to the fullest too.
Looking at the picture I can listen to the theme in the background. Love how Firelink feels like home hustling and bustling with NPCs as we progress through the game.
I'll have to persevere through the game to get to the DLC. I'll keep trying though .
Exactly. All the mechanics of DS1 just feel right.

WRITING.TITLE: Can't get enough of Dark Souls 1.
WRITING.TEXT: Just finished my NG+ run last week. Bought Dark Souls 2 : SotFS immediately. Played a good 20 hours in the last week. But something just doesn't click. Its an amazing game to be honest and in no way do I hate it. But I so love the atmosphere, mechanics of 1, I couldn't resist and started another character in DS1. Just can't get enough of DS1. My appreciation for this game gets deeper each day.
Ohh I do believe everybody hates them here. But also they can very easily ignored.
But they equally hate you.

Always trust waifu.
He's really hesitant though.
Excellent article .

Everyone's first blind playthrough was pretty much like yours. No one knew much. And when people started reading item descriptions, paying attention to world design, boss design, they realised what this game truly had in store. The brilliance of the storyline is that it's never fully revealed. It's up to you to figure it out. Make your own speculations.
There's always NG+ so don't worry and don't you dare go hollow.
But she's so peaceful.

Well Seath created the Moonlight Butterflies. So that explains their presence in the crystal caves. As for the taurus and capra in demon ruins, they were probably just copy pasted because development hell and time crunch. "Demon Ruins" still answers why those demons are there though. They were spawned by the chaos flame in Lost Izalith which is connected to demon ruins.
Silver Knight Archers form Anor Londo.. Be trolling all day.

You come. I forge. we talk. You good friend. I very happy.
I was so sad to see him dead in DS3.

It would be an even greater experience if you would have done Gwyn first and then came across Soul of Cinder in DS3. I had completed DS1 first and then jumped to DS3. I distinctley remember when I finished the first phase of SoC and heard those three notes I literally dropped my controller out of awe and nostalgia. One of my most amazing moments in DS3.
You will find the Archery Club soon. It's pretty fun.
BASS CANON!!! FTW!
From please hire this man.
How will you co-op though?
Reaching Anor Londo for the first time. Really unexpected, truly majestic.
Well I'm from India. Something on Indian mythology would be cool. There are so many gods in Indian mythology. And something set in ancient India would sure be very very atmospheric.

The other day I was wondering what if From got the rights for Prince Of Persia. They would capture the world amazingly well and maybe polish the combat to be more soulsborne like and less hack 'n slash. The lore they would develop would be amazing too.
I'm in too. Why not plan some event?
There are many many to choose from. Like the Falchion, Shotel, Gold Tracer. But if you're going with a dex build the Painted Guardian Sword will be good for you.
For a first try you actually did very very good. Keep pushing.
Search in the areas that connect to Firelink. You'll sure find him.

Most Liked - O S, Artorias.
Most Hated-Gravity, Centipede, BoC, Firesage.
"Meh the game is so old. Looks boring."

Fog wall with no bosses are what made DS1 an actual adventuring experience it was. You didn't know what to expect. Entering a fog wall only to end up in a calm looking room is ant-climatic as fuck. I miss those in the DS3 as all are only boss fight fog gates.
Ohh I didn't watch the whole thing. I must say.. He got gud
Somebody instert a "You Died" text in the end.
From Software doing PoP. That day would be a great day in the history of gaming. Highly unlikely of it happening though.
